newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand to start 96/97 sugar cane crushing Nov 5.
newsitem.headline: Thailand to start 96/97 sugar cane crushing Nov 5.

text.p: Thailand will begin its sugar cane crushing for 1996/97 (November-October) on November 5, an industry ministry official said on Monday.
The crushing that begins on November 5 applies to mills in northeastern region where 11 out of 46 sugar cane crushing mills are located, she said.
The crushing scheduled for the central, northern and eastern regions will be decided later this month by a tripartite committee comprising government representatives, farmers and millers.
The decision is usually based on weather conditions and the readiness of the cane and the mills.
Mills in the northeastern region traditionally start crushing in early November while those in the northern and central area start crushing in December.
There are 46 sugar cane crushing mills at present, 19 in central region, 11 in the northeast, 10 in the north and 6 in the east.
The agriculture ministry on Monday revised the 1996/97 sugar cane output forecast to 61.53 million tonnes from its previous 62.42 million tonne projection due to floods.
